column4: Everytime I use Nautilus to ssh into my server I get a stupid openssh password prompt every time I switch to another folder. I've already entered the password once so why does it keep coming up?
well that's unusual too
Nautilus askes for the password, and its supposed to remember it all the time, so why does a openssh prompt come up if I've already entered it in Nautilus?
does it immediately ask or after a while?
right when I try to do anything with ssh using nautilus
how long passes before asking you for password? immediately? after a while? how long?
Seconds like everytime I click to do ANYTHING that deals with ssh via nautilus
does this happen with a specific host/ip or any host?
well I haven't tried it for another machine yet so idk
try it on your own machine, localhost
It doesn't do it for localhost
do you have an ssh server running?
sudo apt-get install openssh-server (and remove it after testing)
yes on both this machine (that I'm using) and the server that I'm connecting to
so you can connect to localhost using ssh on the command line?
*sighs* No, everything is fine via the command line. Its just nautilus and the openssh-agent
can you connect to localhost or not? 'ssh localhost' on command line works?
Yes I can and that works perfectly
in any case you can use ssh key-based authentication to workaround the password dialog
and if I ssh up to the dell server via the command line it works perfectly
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SSH/OpenSSH/Keys
that looks like a key phrase dialog, not an ssh password dialog
is openssh-agent
